title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 establishes the Denali Commission and outlines its powers, including the acceptance of matching funds for projects. Members of the Commission, except the Federal Cochairperson, are not considered Federal employees. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects. Amendments also clarify the status of Commission members as non-Federal employees. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects. Amendments clarify the status of Commission members as non-Federal employees, with specific provisions for their pay rates and exceptions for those not employed by the Federal Government. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects. Amendments clarify the status of Commission members as non-Federal employees, with provisions for pay rates and exceptions for those not employed by the Federal Government. Members may elect to waive compensation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to appoint necessary personnel and terminate them as needed. The Economic Development Committee section is redesignated as section 311. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to redesignate the Economic Development Committee as section 311 and change "shall" to "may" in its provisions. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to redesignate the Economic Development Committee as section 311 and change "shall" to "may" in its provisions. Special functions of the Denali Commission are outlined in Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska, with a focus on construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. The training program authorized under the Denali Commission Act of 1998 focuses on priorities such as construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects, management training, initiatives for Alaskan youths, and training for public infrastructure projects. Amounts made available for the program. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes a training program for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. Amounts made available for the program remain available until expended. The Commission also provides assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including activities such as housing development, rehabilitation, and construction. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
